headline: Trump gives in to the temptation of regime change in Iran with Operation Epic Fury
description: The American president, in coordination with Israel, has embarked on a war with an unpredictable duration. This runs counter to his promises to the MAGA movement, which has opposed any prolonged military engagement abroad.

headline: Israel and the US attack Iran: What happened in the first hours of bombing
US strikes on Iran reignite fears of rising oil prices
Prosecution requests questionably harsh sentences at murdered teacher Samuel Paty's appeals trial
description: Prosecutors requested 20-year prison sentences for two men behind a hate campaign against the history teacher, who was beheaded outside his school in 2020 after having run a class on cartoons depicting the Prophet Muhammad.

headline: Mélenchon's attempt to embody an 'antifascist arc' backs the rest of the left into a corner
description: Radical leftist leader Jean-Luc Mélenchon has polarized the public debate but still hopes to champion a front to block the far-right Rassemblement National in the 2027 presidential election.

headline: Bruno Mars stays as 'feel good' as ever with his new album, 'The Romantic'
description: The American multi-instrumentalist and singer has released his fourth solo album 10 years after the success of '24K Magic.'

headline: Israel rallies in national unity to support attack on Iran
description: Ahead of October parliamentary elections, on Saturday, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's opponents voiced their support for the US-Israel joint operation against Iran's regime. Israeli public opinion was also ready for a new offensive.

headline: Bolivian military plane carrying cash crashes near La Paz, killing at least 15
Risk of open war between Afghanistan and Pakistan appears contained for now
Epstein case: Bill Clinton scrutinized over past relationship with sexual predator
Behind Trump and Anthropic standoff lies multifaceted debates over military's use of AI
David W. Bates, cybernetics specialist: 'The brain is not a computer'
Trump suggests a 'friendly takeover' of Cuba
How the death of a far-right activist has shaken up the French left's mayoral campaigns
Rwanda: Claude Muhayimana sentenced on appeal to 14 years in prison for complicity in genocide
EU-Mercosur trade deal set to take effect without waiting for European Parliament vote
French court upholds 'far left' label for Mélenchon's LFI
Sweden confirms that drone near French aircraft carrier was Russian
'He changed in a very insidious way': Parents' distress at sons embracing toxic masculinity
How Paris is turning into 'Frollywood,' a refuge for American actors
description: Whether George Clooney, Matt Dillon or Kristen Stewart, France is attracting more and more actors from across the Atlantic. This trend speaks to both the Trump-era crisis and the decline of the Hollywood model.

headline: Ukraine: 'The war could still last for years and paradoxically, time is not on the Kremlin's side'
description: Researcher Dimitri Minic tells Le Monde in an interview that it is 'too soon to write off Ukraine,' even though the balance of power currently favors Russia.

headline: 'The rebuilding of Iran's ballistic capabilities is more concerning than a rapid nuclear restart'
description: In an interview with Le Monde, researcher Nicole Grajewski analyzes the current state of Tehran's military capabilities eight months after the Israeli-American strikes in June 2025.

headline: Mélenchon's deadly race to the bottom
'Women are much more frequently victims of physical violence at work than men'
'Jeffrey Epstein's trajectory shows that bluff and deceit remain commonplace'
